title: 820-01827-A - Sudden death - 19V missing all USB-C port
message:
Hello,

I got this A1990, sudden death, no 19V on all port.

I've disconnect battery and charger and focus on big coil value to ground (in blue on the pics).

I will user  820-01041  in boardview

Thanks
Sam

title: 820-01827-A - Sudden death - 19V missing all USB-C port
message:
Do you get PPBUS_G3H and 3V3_G3H_RTC?
If any missing, post diode mode to ground.

title: 820-01827-A - Sudden death - 19V missing all USB-C port
message:
thanks. I get nothing on both.

Diode mode to ground = 0.25

USB-C chip not talking to charger ?

title: 820-01827-A - Sudden death - 19V missing all USB-C port
message:
You can't get same reading on both rails.
Please, post accurate information.

Do you get 5V at R7020?

title: 820-01827-A - Sudden death - 19V missing all USB-C port
message:
Sorry, 0.331 on  3V3_G3H_RTC 

Yes, I get 5.16V at R7020.

title: 820-01827-A - Sudden death - 19V missing all USB-C port
message:
So you get 0.25 at PPBUS_G3H?

Post basic U7000 voltage; P_IN, AUX_DET, VDDA/P, EN_MVR, CBC_ON, A/BMON.

title: 820-01827-A - Sudden death - 19V missing all USB-C port
message:
PPBUS_G3H = 0.29V
PPBUS_G3H  Diode Mode = 0.03

title: 820-01827-A - Sudden death - 19V missing all USB-C port
message:
Boardview is not exactly same but I beleive U7000 should be this guy "338s00267-a0"? 
Everything on the pics is at 0V.

title: 820-01827-A - Sudden death - 19V missing all USB-C port
message:
[SIZE=4][FONT=arial]Boardview is not exactly same my board, I am not sure which one is U7000. Is it always 
IC ISL6259 QFN32 6259AHRTZ 9AHRTZ ?[/FONT][/SIZE]

title: 820-01827-A - Sudden death - 19V missing all USB-C port
message: according to boardview this could be U7000, looks different compare to what I watch on video.

title: 820-01827-A - Sudden death - 19V missing all USB-C port
message: Could be this one? What I can say is both have 0 V on all components on the pics.

title: 820-01827-A - Sudden death - 19V missing all USB-C port
message:
You have T2 machine, where ISL9240 is used; very small BGA chip; on the other board's side.

"PPBUS_G3H  Diode Mode = 0.03"
No reason to connect power anymore; need to find the culprit first.
Check diode mode to ground on all big coils; see if any has similar value.

title: 820-01827-A - Sudden death - 19V missing all USB-C port
message: Thanks. Ok, no 0.03 on big coil. I am looking for ISL9240 on verso... not found yet.

title: 820-01827-A - Sudden death - 19V missing all USB-C port
message: Check this...

title: 820-01827-A - Sudden death - 19V missing all USB-C port
message: thanks. There's a few caps and resistor to GND.

title: 820-01827-A - Sudden death - 19V missing all USB-C port
message: Compare with 01041/1814 schematic/boardview to identify these components.

title: 820-01827-A - Sudden death - 19V missing all USB-C port
message: Thanks. So shorted to GND by U7000. Need to replace that chip. Anything else to test before ?

title: 820-01827-A - Sudden death - 19V missing all USB-C port
message:
Why do you think the culprit is U7000???

Check resistance to ground at CPU big coils (all of them).

title: 820-01827-A - Sudden death - 19V missing all USB-C port
message:
I did Big coils. Need to do medium one (in blue) ?

I said U7000 as those components are all to GND trough U7000.

title: 820-01827-A - Sudden death - 19V missing all USB-C port
message:
Yeah, that ones too; even L9080/580 for SSD.
Look at schematic and check ANY coil which is part of a secondary power supply connected to PPBUS_G3H.

I'm pretty sure U7000 is not the culprit here.
As per schematic, the marked point is connected to PPBUS_G3H.

title: 820-01827-A - Sudden death - 19V missing all USB-C port
message:
I've measure all. You think I should find a coil open ?

What do you mean by "the marked point is connected to PPBUS_G3H" ?

title: 820-01827-A - Sudden death - 19V missing all USB-C port
message:
You've marked CHGR_CSO_P on U7000; it is connected to F7000/1, as PPBUS_G3H too.

Check direct between PPBUS_G3H and coils marked with 0.02.
You should get 0.05, or 0.01; let us know.

I can't read the values on the SSD coils...

title: 820-01827-A - Sudden death - 19V missing all USB-C port
message:
PPBUS_G3H to the three big coils(0.02) = 0.05
I've added SSD pics.

title: 820-01827-A - Sudden death - 19V missing all USB-C port
message:
That means the short don't come from a secondary power supply.
Just in case, did you check L3500 and L9580 too?
Are placed on the other side of the board.

title: 820-01827-A - Sudden death - 19V missing all USB-C port
message:
Thanks

L3500 to GND = 0.442
L3500 to PPBUS_G3H = 0.468

[B]L9580 to GND = 0.0[/B]
L9580 to PPBUS_G3H = 0.003

L9581 same as L9580

title: 820-01827-A - Sudden death - 19V missing all USB-C port
message:
OK, the short is now found; it is U9580.
Remove U9580 and check diode mode to ground at L9580/81 again.
If still short there, at least one NAND chip is fried.

The short from PPBUS_G3H to ground, will of course disapper.

title: 820-01827-A - Sudden death - 19V missing all USB-C port
message: Sorry for the delay. Ok, NAND is fried. Can Macbook work with one NAND if I remove the faulty one ?

title: 820-01827-A - Sudden death - 19V missing all USB-C port
message:
NO.
In fact, you may need to replace all of them; from donor board, in same position.

title: 820-01827-A - Sudden death - 19V missing all USB-C port
message: Thank you for all your help. So I gave up and reassembled the Mac today. I did a little test before preparing the package. I see it's taking from 0.11 to 1.06 amp when I press the power button. So I tried to put it in DFU, that works. I tried "revive" but it failed with  "the operation couldn't be completed (AMRetoreErrrorDomain error 6 - Failed to handle message type StatusMsg (Operation failed) ... Is it worth try with Apple GSX server ?

title: 820-01827-A - Sudden death - 19V missing all USB-C port
message: I did more test and it's definitely better than before.
